intro: Lonchitis tisserantii, commonly known as the Tisserant's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. Lonchitis tisserantii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
